name: react-flask-pywebview-app
description: A simple boilerplate to start application with pywebview, React and Flask

scripts.init:win32: py -m venv webview-env && .\webview-env\Scripts\python -m pip install -r requirements.txt
scripts.init:linux: python3 -m venv webview-env && if [[ -z "${KDE_FULL_SESSION}" ]]; then yarn init:qt; else yarn init:gtk; fi
scripts.init:gtk: sudo apt install libgirepository1.0-dev gcc libcairo2-dev pkg-config python3-dev gir1.2-gtk-3.0 python3-gi python3-gi-cairo gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 && ./webview-env/bin/python -m pip install pycairo PyGObject -r requirements.txt
scripts.deepclean: shx rm -rf __pycache__ src/__pycache__ .parcel-cache build dist publish
scripts.start: yarn clean && concurrently --kill-others -n REACT,APP -c bgGreen.bold,bgBlue.bold "yarn react-dev" "yarn serve"

author: Wahyu Setianto
